moves.1. e4: A nice little ending I strung together. A higher rated player would probably have seen it but still lost the queen
moves.3. Bb5 Bc5 4. O-O Nf6 5. Nc3 Bd6 6. d3 O: this is where it kicks off, bad move for black next i think
moves.8... h6: black tries to push the bishop away but it is supported by the queen!
moves.9. Bxh6 gxh6: i take the pawn with my bishop and tear open the kings defence
moves.10... Ng4 11. Qh5: opponent tries to push my queen away
moves.13. Nd5+: fores the king to move again
moves.13... Ke6 14. Qxe8+: the player can force a queen swap here by moving the bishop in the way
moves.14... Qxe8: but the queen is to tempting and....

opening: Ruy Lopez (C64), classical defence, Zaitsev variation
